playn.core.util

Interface Clock

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Clock.Source

    public interface Clock
    Used to provide the current interpolated time. The Source implementation takes care of tracking and computing the current interpolated time. Use like so: 
    
 class MyGame extends Game.Default {
   private final static int UPDATE_RATE = 50;
   private final Clock.Source clock = new Clock.Source(UPDATE_RATE);
   public MyGame () {
     super(UPDATE_RATE);
   }
   @Override public void update (int delta) {
     clock.update(delta);
   }
   @Override public void paint (float alpha) {
     clock.paint(alpha);
     // pass clock into any code that needs an alpha-adjusted timestamp
   }
 }

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Clock.Source
      A Clock implementation that works nicely with Game.Default.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float alpha()
      Returns the current paint call's alpha.
      float dt()
      Returns the ms between the current alpha-adjusted paint time (aka time()) and the last alpha-adjusted paint time.
      float time()
      Returns the current time, adjusted for the latest paint's alpha.

    • Method Detail

      • time

        float time()
        Returns the current time, adjusted for the latest paint's alpha.

      • dt

        float dt()
        Returns the ms between the current alpha-adjusted paint time (aka time()) and the last alpha-adjusted paint time. Some animation APIs really just want to know how many ms have elapsed since they last did their interpolation, and this saves them the trouble of having to track it themselves.

      • alpha

        float alpha()
        Returns the current paint call's alpha.
